name: disengagement
content:

the fact of stopping being involved in something: disengagement from Young people's disengagement from politics is part of a wider trend. The new president is thought likely to pursue military disengagement. See
disengage
More examplesFewer examplesThis disengagement from social life is thought to be natural in older people, but there is no reason why it should be.Network TV has concerns over the disengagement of younger viewers. I think it comes down to apathy or selfish disengagement in the case of many people.The rising sophistication of electronics has accelerated society's disengagement with nature.He called for a ceasefire and disengagement of forces.
